description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThis project targets Tanzania, especially Arusha, where the groundwater is very contaminated (mainly fluor) and piped water is contaminated. The COWSO’s/AUWSA in Arusha region are fully cooperating. The project aims at ensuring local access to safe and healthy drinking water by collecting and treating the rainwater (priority of the decentralized drinking water policy). The solution combines the latest technology developed by WIC, the innovator/inventor of the Water from Heaven/Mbinguni Maji technology. The technology is aimed to remove bacteria, viruses and nutrients with ultrafiltration membrane technology to use rain water to meet drinking water standards, and to remove nutrients, if these are present in rainwater in Arusha such as NH4+, TOC, NO3- (by using Denutritor, a bio filter). In Tanzanian the technology prevents fluorosis, a disease caused by dissolved fluoride in groundwater causing serious health damage. The purified and sterilized water produced by the technology can be stored in closed systems and can be kept safe for times of droughts in the same way as bottled water. Therefore, this approach leads to safe and secure water supply. The project will demonstrate the solution in 5 different locations for 5 different circumstances and target groups.• Initial activities and results of the projectThe proposed pilot projects will be in Arusha and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania in five different locations:Pilot 1: Water Institute in Dar Es Salaam – for R&D and collaboration with Water Ministry;Pilot 2: In Emmanuel primary school, Ngarenanyuki – provide safe drinking water to children;Pilot 3: With local water operator Kikatiti (Cowso-2) in a water Kiosk (selling water;)Pilot 4: Horticulture industry (Schoneveld Breeding in Oldonyosambu – potential market in agriculture sector);Pilot 5: Nkoaranga Lutheran Hospital Arusha – to help sick patients.The pilot phase is divided in 3 phases:- First phase of around 6 months is crucial and includes the detailed engineering, construction, installing and start-up of the pilot installations and analytical programme, which we shall intensively monitoring;- The second phase of around 14 to 16 months (this period covers the wet and dry periods during the year) months, includes the pilot test phase; if it is started up and eventually problems are solved the pilot shall run without problems (experience during ongoing tests), the same for the analytical programme;- The third phase of around 4 months, includes the evaluation and reporting of the pilot investigations and scaling up plan.• What makes the technology, product, method or approach used innovativeMbinguni Maji (Water from Heaven/Hemel(s)water®) is a new, innovative drinking water technology, using rainwater as the water source. The water produced is guaranteed drinking water quality (WHO). Operation and maintenance of the unit is very simple (closed membranes systems). The technology has been tested and proved to produce excellent drinking water quality in the Netherlands. Feasibility of technology in the African context has not yet been studied.
